(Bottle)  Pours a cloudy orange body with a medium white head.  Aroma of floral, corn grain, perfume, and light citrus.  Flavor of sweet corn, honey, and under baked doughy biscuit.

Smells of sharp, unripened banana right off the spout, with sugary grain malts. Very slight honey, also. Pours slightly cloudy bronze-gold with very little head and medium carbonation. Has a very pungent honey taste with maple sugar malts. Has an excellent mouth feel that isnt as light as one may think. With the muted hops, there is still a slight bitterness emerging. There are some dark notes lurking as well, with maple syrup, hazelnut, plantains, and wet hay. The complexity is worked heavily into the sweetness of this beer, and it is a sweetness that isnt overbearing. The perfect spring beer.

Bouteille 2007 (750ml), courtoisie de Hogtownharry. De couleur ambrée et voilée. Nez malté de céréales, moyen de caramel sucré et de pain, léger de biscuits au miel, de levures fruitées (léger dagrumes, traces de pommes) et de houblon herbeux (notes florales) avec des notes dalcool, dépices (notes de poivre et de muscade) et de vanille. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et légèrement croustillant ainsi quune texture moyennement crémeuse et aux notes sirupeuses. Goût de levures fruitées (léger dagrumes, notes de poires, traces de pommes et de pêche), de céréales ainsi que des petites notes de légumes bouillis sucrés et de vanille dès lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de pain sucré, de malt du genre caramel moyennement sucré (léger de butterscotch et petites notes de toffee rôti), de biscuits au miel et des petites traces de sucre blanc puis en finale lon retrouve un goût moyennement amer de houblon herbeux (gazon mouillé, notes dherbes fraîches), légèrement floral et aux petites notes terreuses accompagné dun moyen goût dalcool un peu réchauffant ainsi quun goût de levures épicées (léger de poivre et de muscade) et asséchantes. Post-goût moyen-long et sec, moyennement amer de houblon herbeux, dalcool, de levures fruitées (notes de poires et de zest dagrumes) avec des notes poivrées et des traces de vanille.

Pumpkin yellow in color. Tightly packed white head clings nicely with each gulp. Minerals, peach marmalade and cookie-like Munich entice the olfactory senses. Delightfully perfumey and honeyish. Natural carbonation is fluffy on the palate. Firm and snappy Munich malt is immediately enhanced by a delicate phenolic bite and a hint of pineapple which buoys and complements the sweet and well-textured malts. Assertive yet clean hop bitterness is lush and fairly oily. Alcohol is nary a factor, but does impart some nice peppery warmth as well as accentuating the bitterness. Very cleanly attenuated, and the scant marmalade and baked apple fruitiness which remains, beautifully dovetails with the fresh hay and honeyed-biscuit Munich quality. Exemplary overall balance. A limpness begins to tarnish a bit of the malt definition halfway through the bottle. Deeply dextrinous and compact malt frame merges with a lime-accented bitterness at the finish and a sweet honey-glazed pear flavor which lingers. This is quite the lively example, as its rather phenolic and estery. The bottle conditioning does an especially fine job of cradling the flavors. Another commendable effort by Smutty.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: A hazy amber ale with a thick white head. Aroma of fruity esters, coriander, cloves, very pleasant. In mouth, a sweet spiced yeast malt, with notes of pepper and cloves, warming alcohol. Rich bodied, enjoyable.
This beer has the most flowery aroma I have ever smelled in any beer.  The hop aroma are like sticking you head in a sack of wildflowers.
Pours a Golden Orange with a 1 finger white head. Grassy sweet aroma. Nice malt sweetness with a peppery dry finish. Nicely Balanced. A wonderful beer.

Somewhat viscous golden body with moderate carbonation and a robust, dense white head.  Yeasty sourdough aroma with light citric, melon, and peanut qualities, plus clean perfumy highlights.  Smooth and pleasant malty flavor with good relative depth.  Includes some nice spice and floral characters as well.  Medium sweet with nice balancing, natural bitterness.  Overall this has an interesting blend of heat, yeasty phenols, and hop flavor and bittering compounds and is nicely rounded and fairly complex.  Doesnt stray into malt liquor territory like some maibocks do.  This is the best maibock Ive had so far.

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2011 Very fine stuff, and pretty refreshing on this blazing hot day. Much more malty than Id anticipated, and not quite as crisp as Id wanted for the style, but its flavorful and full. Nice.

Bottle purchased at State Line Liquors in MD, shared with Taylor.  Pours a light orange with a small white head. Nose is  banana, bubblegum and honey. Flavor is much the same--very sweet with lots of honey and banana bubblegum flavors.  Hops hardly noticed. Alcohol noticed, but for the most part well hidden as this as very smooth and light mouthfeel. Pretty good, but a little too sweet at times.
Aroma was of a lot of fruitiness and a light maltiness. A little medicinal notes to this. Had a weird taste to it that threw me off a litle bit.

Aroma:mixe of caramel and citrus,ligh oxydation aroma....à
Appearance:light hazy amber,huge head...
Flavor:fully caramel,good bitterness,citrus hops...

Bottle; Poured a golden-orange; small to medium somewhat creamy head.  
Aroma of citrus, caramel , yeast, malt and alcohol.   Slightly sweet; alcohol; citrus; malt; light hops. Hints of honey.

22 oz bottle split two ways.  Hazy amber in color with a medium off white head.  Aroma was not quite what I expected- a good dose of caramel, but with some citrus hops, orange, grapefruit.  Taste is big, smooth and malty with some citrus, floral, and a light pine hop bitterness.  perfectly balanced, doesnt seem made to style with the hop profile, but this is a great american style-may bock.

(22 oz bottle (2007) from <A HREF=http://www.ratebeer.com/Place/maryland/baltim target=blank>Wells Discount Liquors) Good but deviates from style with lots of hops...Pours lightly brownish gold, cloudy. Four fingers of foamy white head. Aroma of caramel, honey, pine, vanilla, bread and hay. More pine than normal (for a heller bock). Mouthfeel quite full, smooth, even a little sticky. Big patches and rings of foamy lacing. Flavor of pine over caramel but I think the pine wins. Almost big IPA-like. Not that its tons of hops but I think the malt takes a back seat when a great bock should be richly malty. The flavor also has notes of  honey, hay and vanilla and is a little hot esp. in finish. Has a big beer feel and I enjoyed it even if Im not sure about it being a really good bock.

Rating No. 1212.  Bottle.  Big bready malty nose, light fruity accents.  Rich clear golden pour with a soapy off-white / eggshell head.  Moderately crisp body, medium-full and very, very dry with light yeasty notes.  Taste is all malt with faintly prickling hops.  Touch of alcohol, and a little bit of heft.  Could be a bit softer, smoother (a little harsh), but otherwise, a great addition to the Smutty stable and a good brew.

22 oz bottle.  Dark golden color.  Large white head.  Aroma is sweet with lemons and some sugar.   Flavor is also sweet, with a nice hit of citrus flavor in the finish.  Over all I think this beer was pretty decent.

Pours a dark golden from the 22 oz. bomber.  A large pure white head slowly disapated, leaving a nice lacing ring around the glass.  The scent was lemon, candy and some sweetness.  The mouthfeel is clean and crisp with some notes of grain, candy and floral spices.  Very refreshing.

Dark golden color, plenty carbonated, thick white head.  Mild sugar candy and dough aroma.  Somewhat sweet and sticky palate, a bit of alcohol flavor and bite at the back of the throat.  A negative to me.  Not bad but lacks the complexity of some of the German offerings.
Big powerful bockbier here.  Beautiful copperish brown color to this lager and big malt nose give this beer a uniqueness in our IPA-centric world.  Smuttynose makes another winner, that fn simple.

22oz bottle-pours a big foamy off white head that laces and slightly hazy gold color.  Aroma is light malt-some caramel, grain.  Taste is light/medium malt-caramel/honey, grain, fruit, secondary/faint hops bite and alcohol.  Finishes with earthy/spicy/flat hops.   Right on style.  Medium body.  OK carbonation.
On tap @ Coles Buffalo NY. Coppered colored brew with nice head. Bready, yeasty, touch of sweetness. Alcohol sort of sneeks up on you . well done

22 oz. I bought a few weeks ago (also just got one as a bonus from bmartin08 - thanks!!) Golden color with a nice pillowy head.  Aroma has a nice crisp citrus essence mixed with freshly-baked bread.  Flavor has a bit of tart citra-sweetness with some pleasant bready malts, fresh honey, and enough hops to remind you that this aint no weak ass lager.  Nice brew - really makes you think of a warm spring day.

Pours copper with a nice white sustained head.  Smells of biscuits, citrus, lemons, a nice caramelly malty backdrop and some rosey hints.  Tastes of caramel, mellow malt, light peppery splashes, hints of citrus, some earthiness and honey.  Mouthfeel is sugary with a light hoppy finish.  This is an excellent interpretation of the style.

Poured a crisp golden color with a foamy, lacing white head.  Aroma is all spice and yeast with very little noticeable hop.  Flavor is more of the same, spicy/herby with a distinct European yeast flavor.  Light malt, slight bitterness from the hops.  Finish is nice, slightly thick tipping off the heavier alcohol.  I dont love the style, but they really got what they were going for which is respectable.
Bottle: Pours an orange gold with a white head. Aroma, pale malts, bready, some spice. Flavor, sweet pale malts, some yeast, toffee. Pretty solid.

Slightly hazy, amber/orange appearance with a medium size, off white head and good lacing.  Sweet, caramel malt aroma accented with soft fruits.  Pleasing, toffeeish taste, sweet, fruity, malty, mildly herbal, with a low keyed hop presence.  Mouthfeel is medium bodied with a decent amount of carbonation.  Long lasting, honeyed finish.

The highest rated maibock not retired apparently.  Pours clear copper color and one finger of head.  Aroma is honey, nutsm and a little nail polish remover.  Flavor is surprisingly bitter.  A bit of grape juice, honey, and a little spice.  quite sweet.  finishes with a hint of alcohol.  perhaps one of the better bocks but not a very strong category in my opinion. prickly carbonation.
Clear golden body with a thick white head.  Sweet, malty, lightly spicy  aroma.   Initial sweet honeyed taste, followed by grassy, grape, bready flavor.  Dry, modestly bitter aftertaste.

Pours a golden color with some amber hues, nice frothy generous head, great lacing. The aroma was honey, earthen and grassy hops, rich bready malts. The flavor was excellent bready malts, light honey, some grass, a nice spiciness along with carbonated zing. The malts had a grapey-ness to go along with the bready richness, and this was a very fine example of the style, top notch. Mouthfeel was full, rich, yet balanced, very clean feeling. At-a-boys, Smutty!!!

22 oz bomber.  Hazy deep golden colour, white head.  Very fresh malty aroma, pale and sweet, light herbal hop aroma as well.  Flavour is quite grassy and freshly herbal with a bit of sweetness and light honey character.  Nice tasty maibock.

Poured a voluptuously effervescent golden with a fizzy off-white head which dissipated completely.  Aroma of some light toffee, a bit of herbal grass, some light spiciness, nice but not too complex or assertive.  Flavor however is quite good... an apple and caramel sweetness comes up first, followed quickly by a strong herbal grassy hoppiness, a bit of dry toffee, and a surprisingly refreshing dry finish.  Warming.  Clearly an American interpretation with the noticeable hops and alcohol, but a welcome one.  Very nicely balanced and refreshing.

Clear pale body with small white head. The aroma is herbal, bread, honey, apple and peach. The flavor is slightly sweet, honey, apple juice and herbal. Medium body is round with soft carbonation and a slightly warm finish.

22oz bottle, courtesy of artusory.  Thanks, Ryan!  Pours a hazy, golden-amber color; white head with good lacing.  Maple syrup and floral hops in the aroma.  Average carbonation.  Medium mouthfeel: candy sugar and dried fruits; malt-dominated, with some hops; alcohol definitely showing through.  Lengthy, hoppy and boozy finish.

Tap at Blind Tiger. Pours darkish yellow with a nice white cap. Floral nose with a wonderfully balanced flavor, between crisp refreshing hops and a wonderful, thick but refreshing body. Good bready malts and a touch of sweetness. Very nice beer.

22 oz. brown bomber bottle. No freshness date seen. Poured out a bright, clear orange color, with a huge off-white colored head. left a sticky lacing down the side of the glass. Aromas are of slightly roasted malt, sweet orange blossom honey, funky lager yeast.
Flavors are of honey, sweet malts, dry biscuits, slightly roasty too. Thick mouthfeel, rich body. Chewy in texture, sweet aftertaste. Slightly dry finish, like honey. Damn good beer overall.

On tap at Bacchus, New Paltz.  This beer was an assault of honey from first sniff to last sip.  It even poured a honey color.  It started out pleasantly sweet but by the end of the beer the sweetness was overwhelming.  Not something I would try again.

22 oz bottle.  Clear toasted orange with a bubbly white head.  Yeasty orange toffee with fresh grass and oats.  Taste conforms its Spring!  Quenching carb cuts through a slightly oily body with a density thats substantial but still refreshing.  Apricot and unripe melon.  Sours with a bit of cherry; finally lemon pith.
A malt drinkable treasure followed by an expected malted down  bitterness, caramel and smooth.   More German than if German brewed.  Great drinkability. Medium mouthfeel.

(draft @ The Old Toad - Rochester, NY) Hazy orange color with a creamy off-white head. Aroma is nice and malty with some spices mixed in as well. Some fruits. Flavor has a fruit sweetness with a light hop flavor mixed in, with a very malty and smooth middle and a slightly spicy but sweet finish.

Tap.  Pours a clear orangey amber with a slight, quickly disappearing head.  Nose is malty and clean with fruit.  Flavor is macerated fruit with a slight hop hit, but ever so slight.  This is pretty much a sweet fruited malt attack.  Easy to drink and well balanced.  Nice session brew.
Cloudy amber body with a medium creamy light tan head. Sweet fruity malt and caramel aroma. Sweet caramel and sugar flavor.

On tap at Barcade:  A malty, pretty sweet Maibock.  Not overally hopped, but more hops than I expected from the style.  Pretty well-balanced. The body color is medium amber, with a small white head.  Some citrus and honey in the flavor make it quite pleasant.  Refreshing and clean.
On tap at Mile Square in Hoboken.  I Really liked this beer.  It was sweet and malty, with just the right amount of hops.  Very drinkable.  Perfect for a session.

22oz - 2007 -  Lightly hazed yellow, fizzy white head.  The aroma held notes of warmed honey bread with a softer floral and vanilla caramel accent.  Soft sweet bread and honey flavors are balanced well with a light peppery citric hoppiness.  Medium bodied, medium carbonation, bittersweet finish.  Well done in my book and quite drinkable...

Bottle (22oz) shared with HogTownHarry, tupalev & biegaman -- courtesy of HogTownHarry. Pours a clear amber-orange with a large lasting fluffy white head. Aroma is sweet and vegetal along with some mild hops. Flavour is malty with a bit of fruit and some hops in the finish. Medium bodied. Not bad for the style I guess but it doesnt do much for me, just not my style.

an interesting blend of yeast, hops and malt.  the yeast is not overpowering and works well with the grassy hops.  it has a very slight bitter but the malt smooths that over.  a well rounded and unique flavor.  pours translucent copper with white head.  definitely worth tasting.

(draft) Lightly hazed apple juice topped by an off-white head that leaves nice lacing.  Aroma is medium sweet, caramel, some toasted/bread, light honey.  Taste is moderately sweet, caramel, some peach syrup, lager yeast, light toast, alcohol.  Sticky medium-full body.

Clear amber/orange with a large head. Good lacing and good retention. Aroma of floral and spicy hops with some caramel and paler malts and nuts. Medium body. Balanced bitter and sweet taste. Very nice.
Nice unfiltered/bottle conditioned lager. The beer is hazy and very malty, but not overly sweet. The hops are there just enough to balance out the malt. Well done and clean tasting.

Bottle courtsey of bmartin08 and The_Epeeist, thanks guys.   Pours a coppery color with a decent sized off-white to beige colored head.   Aroma is sweet caramel malts, honey, pear, citrus.   Flavor is caramel malts, sweet pear and peach, brown sugar, some citrus notes.   Palate is medium bodied, medium carbonation, on the sweet side with a crisp, spicy, sorta saison like finish.   Great!

Bottle (22oz).  Shared with blankboy, biegaman and tupalev, my bottle.  Hazy light amber, decent off-white head.  Slightly vegetal and sweet malt aroma, light fruity floral hops.  Taste - alcohol, cereal grain, sweet lightly fruity malt - nice.  Average body, quick finish, passable carbonation.  Its okay, a little warming, ehhhh.

Bomber. Bronze with a big tan head. Nice lace. Nose is lots of sweet, caramelly malt with a bit of fruit and light, earthy hops. Well carbonated. Not quite as sweet as many maibocks, which is good IMO, sweet honey and caramel malt, just a touch sticky, but the stickiness does not detract. Smooth, lightly sweet finish, just a bit of earthy hop bite. Nice stuff.

22 oz bottle 2007 .. deep golden pour thin white head ,good lacing. sweet aroma of lemon , lavender and bananas  . sweet , bready caramel malt flavors . slight spicy hop up front that turns sweet and doughy . very refreshing , smooth , medium bodied mouthfeel. sorta like a super saison . good stuff .

Very thin white head which fades rapidly.  Clear orange/golden body with a very slight haziness.  Sweet malty, sugary, caramel aroma with a bit of floral character.  Flavors were very malty and sweet with brown sugar, caramel, and some spiciness.  A very slight hint of hops.  Palate was slightly sticky and sweet, but well-carbonated and with a very abrupt finish.  Very good stuff.

Practically clear with a rich orange-gold hue.  Thin head.  Aromas of lavender, lemon, perfume with a bit of caramel and toast beneath all the fragrant smells.  A little bitterness up front changes to a buttery middle and long butterscotch/caramel finish.  Again, fragrant hops and well-integrated caramel and sweet malts.  Really good stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2007 Hazy bronze, large head with good lacing and retention. Aroma is huge bread and caramel. Hops are there but play a minor role. Medium bodied with a velvety mouthfeel, fairly sweet. Liquid bread.

Bomber from Oaktree for $4.99.  Bottle conditioned with a nice thin yeast sludge on the bottom!   Pours a chill-hazed dirty blonde/deep gold- lighter than ramstein.  Thins whitish head and some nice cobwebby lace.  Aroma is quite different than ramstein but still is very pleasant.  Light tropical fruits, floral and lightly grassy hops, tea-like0 earthy and almsot a spicy saison-like aroma with some sweetish caramel malt hints.  Nice thick sweet bready and caramel malt flavor- smooth, warm doughy malts as well with an underlying herbal and floral hop character.  Very smooth mouthfeel and palate with a clean doughy malt finish.  Really nice, and despite the high scores I was a bit hesitant to even buy this.  Very good though, but still not quite on par with ramstein.

22 oz. bottle from 2007.  A slightly hazy gold pour with some floaties and a thick light-tan head.  Hints of bananas, pears, honey and vanilla in the sweet, bready aroma.  Medium to full-bodied.  Sugary and syrupy.  Overly ripe pears, bananas, vanilla extract, caramel and sweet malts dominate the flavor.  Kinda buttery.  Some herbal qualities and hints of warming alcohol throughout.  Good beer, but not a style Im overly fond of.
pours a hazey yellow. aroma of a yeast and fruit. taste a banana and some fruit the lager stands out with warming. very yummy.

On tap at Ortinos Northside. Appears a golden amber with a small off white head. Small streaks of lace are left around the glass.
Smell is of mildly sweet doughy, honey biscuit malt.
Taste is of the sweet aromas with a bit of apple and a bit of a citrus and vegatal taste coming through that wasnt overly appealing.
Mouthfeel was crisp, warming, and sweet with a lip smacking sugary syrup feel.

Smuttynose Maibock pours to a beautiful, bright, deep amber to brown color with a thick and creamy tan head that slowly fades and a moderate amount of carbonation. The nose on this beer is wonderful, with big sweet malty, nutty, slightly toasty aromas and hints of peppery alcohol heat. The palate is rich and full on the tongue with a sea of smooth malt flavors. Flavors of sweet malt, toast and nuts are slighty sticky on the toungue as the glide down. Smuttynose Maibock finishes with more of those sweet malty nutty and toasty flavors, and ends with a slightly cloying, and warming burn. 

This beer is a wonderful example of Maibock, a beer style that is a bit hard to find in ale dominated New England.
Beautiful color!  I wishFeria made a  "Maibock" color.  Not all that much aroma to it, but a tasty malty taste with a slight hoppy bite in the end.  Really good stuff.

Poured cloudy orange with a thick tan head.  The head was very creamy.  The aroma was rum, caramel and honey.  Flavor had a great maltiness with vanilla in the mix.  This tasted stronger than other Maibocks Ive had.  Great maltiness on the palate as well.  This is one of the best Maibocks Ive had.

Hazy, bright orange in color with a booming, solid, tan, thick and massive head.  Aroma is caramel, anise and something fiery - potentially pepper.  Sweet and bold to the nose.  Flavor?  Yes.  Rich, sweet caramel paired with vanilla butter cream.  Unfiltered aspect lends itself to a grainy, toasted complex.  Its somewhat of a conundrum to detail individual flavors because everything is in harmony  nice and smooth.  Some jumpy hops liven things up and give a touch of bitterness.  Carbonation, malts and hops are well-proportioned but equally bold.  Chewy malts and big-bodied.  No, better yet, this beer is fat.  Finish is creamy vanilla custard and some cackled pepper here and there.  Dry, caramel chew aftertaste.  Smuttynose continues to impress the hell out of me.  Big thanks to tpkenned for the bomber.

Bottle-conditioned, hazy with the yeast shot, earthy amber topped by a generous diminishing, but lacing off-white head. Pleasant fresh deep malt nose. It is even more expressive in mouth, probably more intense than a traditional maibock, but the way those flavors are displayed and coming up together is worth driving a few ultra miles (oh no.. actually ClarkVV brought that to me from liquorinos, thanks Clark!). A blend of citrus (pinneaple mostly, but also orange blossom and other fruits like peaches) and creamy, bready honey. Excellent demonstration of the power of toasted malt. It almost comes out with smoky hints, I truly want to see Smuttynose trying a smoked beer.. Yummy that would be. The toasted aspects shine in here, creating a chewy biscuit aspect working together with the bitterness. Globally sweet though drying out adequately toward the end. Quaffable medium body with excellent moderately high carbonation. 7.7%, are you kidding? I could have downed this bomber in less than 5 minutes. Plenty of earthy, floral and herbal scents from the hops. A soldier worthy of every markmanship awards!
real solid beer, pours an tannish orange that is very cloudy, nice malty flavor with maybe just a kiss of alcohol, one of my favorite styles, a definate winner

Ive had this about 4 times and havent bothered to rate it yet.  I like this stuff...cant wait for it and the Ramstein Maibock to come out again so I can compare them fresh!  This has a more herbal hop component, starting in the middle and finishing through to the swallow, making it ever-so-slightly astringent instead of sticky.  Oh yum.  The malt is the shiner, though, of this duo.  Warm, butter-caramel-honey-nutmeg-syrup-peachy-fruity in a dark amber/rusty orange thick body topped by a pouffy white head.  I like this beer.
Pours copper with big, off-white head.  Aroma of malt, fruit, hops.  Tastes malty, with some hops and fruit.  Medium palate, with a slightly dry, fruity finish.  Good complexity and balance.

Smells fresh with a certain toasted spicy scent to it.  The main smell is fruity, I think it is banana but not sure.  Pours a nice red/orange brown with good off white head that leaves lacing, the head is very frothy and yeasty.  The flavor is very nice and complex yet simple.  It has a sweet side complimented by slight bitterness.  It also has a floral aftertaste and finishes smooth.  This is one hell of a beer.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2005 2004 bomber.  Pours a lightly golden, soft yellow with amber and orange hints.  Bottle conditioned, with tons of white head.  Aroma of lightly spicy yeast, ripe yellow fruits and plenty of grainy malt goodness (honey wheat bread with herbs and spices).   Flavor has just the perfect balance of malt sweetness and mixes with a mild and soily/earthy hops profile that is just right.  The yeast and hops together add a perfect balancing bitterness, this beer has a soft smooth body and is just supremely drinkable and good.  These guys are great with balance (and thats great with me).  Maybe a bit too much sugary sweetness, to be constructive and it could stand a bit more yeast influence.

Clear, rich amber color, big head of active foam atop, quick to crumble.
Nose is soft, dry, vegetal/herbal, leaning into a certain sweetness. Very stately and assure.
Taste is rich and full, fresh with a bright fruity quality, berries and apples, and such, but that loses hold, as the flavor feels more coppery and buttery at swallows end. Maltiness reigns supreme here, and hops entertain a mere tingle at the fore. Body is medium, at best, and the finish is long, flavorful, and ultimately dry. 
An interesting maibock, one that I think I like...this is sophisticated, truly mature, not oversome in flavorful and sweet, buttery malt, but, rather, like Baby Bears hand-me-downs, ju-ust right.
Good balance, good taste, just plain ol good...and thats good!
Very happy to have a full 22 ounces all to myself, (this should cover me for the night)...
Beautiful orange hued beer with big white head. Malty nose with crisp lager characteristics. Smooth  malty flavor with just enough bitterness to offset the sweetness. Nice warming alcohol. Good beer.

Sparkling clear amber-orange body. The tan head is large and foamy. Lacing is excellent. Nice complex sweet malt nose. The flavor is very nice, complex maltiness, spicy, earthy, sweet, all that! Hops are very subdued. The palate is divine, medium-full and lively. What a nice beer. These Smutynose guys continue to impress.

Pours and incredible translucient copper color with a tall fluffy ivory head that leaves moderate lacing. Aroma has a fruity maltiness  and a good clean sweetness. Taste starts with a semisweet maltiness, some caramel tastes take over the middle, and it ends with just a faint bitterness to balance it out. Very smooth and clean taste that is really impressive. Another great Smuttynose brew.

Draft at VT Brewers Fest - Dark amber in color with a thin off white head.  Aroma is of malt/caramel with some fruitiness.  Flavor is slightly sweet and quite malty with a pleasant caramel/toffee underpinning.  Alcohol is apparent only in the finish.  Great mouth feel.  Excellent.
Smooth and slick.  Pleasantly malty without being cloying.  I remember this brew sporting a fine hue in the glass.  I would like to try the bottle version.

Sweet caramel and fruit in the aroma. Clear dark golden colour with thin white head that lasts nicely. Some lacing. Malty, sweet caramel and toffee. Quite fruity. Hints of alcohol apparent towards the finish. Lasting sweetness on the tongue. Sticky without being syruppy or cloying. Medium body and smooth in the mouth with just enough carbonation to keep it interesting. On tap at the Vermont Brewers Festival.

sampled at ehe VT brewers fest.  Clear dark honey color with small off white head.  Pit fruit aroma, plums & raisins.  Mmm, quite good, mellow start leading to a decent alcohol burn in the middle.  Finish is sweet, yet bitter.  Decent.

Pours a clear dark copper with a nice off-white head.  Aroma boasts plenty of rich caramel malt with a nice lager yeast background.  Starts syrupy sweet and thick with nice complexity, light toffee and butterscotch with a hint of light fruits and a hoppy bitterness showing up at the end.  Fresh, bold, sweet, and flavorful, a very nice maibock.  Thanks boto!

I have tried alot of Maibocks and this was only about par when it comes to the style.  Nothing outstanding, just your average color, aroma, and taste, with nothing spectacular.  Still worth a try though.

Tap @ Andys. Clear almost amber pour with nice thick head and cool lacing. Big malt aroma with some faint hints of citrus. Taste has a dough quality, like raw biscuits. Light bodied and very smooth. Very tasty.

This generates an intensely creamy, dense head over a clear, copper colored body.Very pretty beer. The aroma is malt, yet lacks intensity. The flavor is overly hoppy and out of balance for a Bock as well. Needs more maltiness all around. Not to the same caliber as their Robust Porter. I like a good Bock and this just isnt it.
Botte: Tart and somewhat hoppy (grassy, citric) for a bock; not overly smooth, and certainly not very flavorful for a big brew. Tingling alcoholic bite, though.

pours dark redish brown in color.  has a nice head that goes away quickly.  plenty of co2 in this brew.  taste is very malty with a nice little touch of hops added in for a kick in the aftertaste.  a pretty well brewed beer that is not as good as their imp stout, but its worth trying if you havent had it before.  not something im going to want to aquire again, but i like to say i had this brew.  good

This is a well made beer, but sadly a style that doesnt get me excited.  Light to medium amber in appearance, medium lasting head.  Faint bready aroma.  Flavor is medium sweet malt with a decent bitter finish.  Touch rough on the palate, almost over-carbonated.  Again, a nicely balanced, well made beer, but nothing stood out.
Nice, long lasting head, good transparent coppery color. A good malty taste was followed by the hop bitterness at the end. Perhaps a shade too bitter.

Draft.  Transparent copper color with frothy off-white head.  Mild aroma, slightly sweet and malty aroma.  Start is slightly sweet, malty, then alcohol burn.  Perhaps some citrus to finish,  A good maibock, but ethanol is too present.  On draft at Clarks Ale House in Syracuse, NY.

incredible! poured a brownish copper color with a thin white head.  head had great retention.  aroma was hoppy and peppery.  Taste had caramel and hops.  The transition of flavours really impressed me initally being sweet and then cascading into a nice hoppy tone. Real good on the mouth.  Almost perfect.

Bottle: Very good Maibock.  Transluscent brown to copper in color and mine poured with fair sized white head.  Aroma is very noble hoppy, peppery, grassy with a touch of malt.  The flavor is carmel and hops.  It is slightly bitter.  Dry finish, good beer.
Pours a brownish orange color. This is a rich, full bodied bock, chewy with some caramel, with a dry finish. Solid.
Very nice, medium orange and transparent.  Big head faded fast.  Fruity bread taste very fresh, decent amount of hopiness chimed in in the long pleasant finish - excellent
Excellent. Golden orange in color. Malty flavors. Nice head. Robust flavors. Clean. Great beer.

Dave Yarrington kicks ass with this one!!!! Pours a clear orange-yellow. Nice tannish head. Clean malty-bread aroma. Big malty robust flavor. Obvious Munich and/or Vienna maltiness. This would be a favorite next to Ramstein.
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text: NIce malty aroma(touch of grain)certainly some hops,nutty.Orange/brown in color.Nice phat head and lace.Sweet malt/toffee/hops in the taste,some yeast.Nice full on medium bodied lager.Very nice stuff,as usual with Smuttynose.Keep up the great work guys!

(22oz bottle) Pours a large, yellowish foamy head and an orange body. Light carbonation with small bubbles. Nose of lemon, sweet malt, slight tin and mild hops. Palate is very full and complex. Mountainous-cloud of flavour leaves you flying on a glider, very malty and creamy. Tart finish brings us in for a landing. Ill definitely seek this out again!
Sour/sweet aroma of bitter hops.  Rich sweet malt, lemon and a kick of bitterness with a nice creamy body

650mL Bottle 5/03, 04.23.04.  Pours an orangey gold, clouded,  minimal head, tons of lacing.  Aromas are fascinatingly unusual - heaps of malt, caramel, milk, a pile of pulled weeds, and salt air?  Flavors...Wow!...all kinds of sweet, sweet malted layers: milky sweetness, some malted milk candy, potato.  There is a touch of bitterness in the finish, then (and this is unusual to me) there is a second finish that is not bitter, but earth, applesauce, butter.  This beer is ridiculously good, much better than I expected.  The texture, like the flavor, is creamy and sugary (not cloying) at first, but finishes lighter and a bit dry.  My only complaint is that the finish may be too dry, but I'm not too familiar with the style.
On tap.  A perfect coppery color with a wonderfully complex nose.  I love the sweet malty flavor.  Just another affirmation on how wonderful Smuttynose's stuff is.

Bottle: Nice nose, Tea, carmel, Wet leaves, Apricot brandy. Brownish orange color, Clean, no sediment. No head to speak of. Sweet and burnt. Fruit, asour apple and oranges, bit medicine. Little oily, but sweet clean finish. Good beer, but a tad sweet for my overall preference.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Sweet caramel malt aroma, very little head.  Sweet malt flavor with a fruity twang and hoppy undertones at the finish.  This beer is 100% maibock!  Very sweet and a not a session beer IMO but very good.  Smuttynose is one quality brewer.  Many thanks to Goz for this gem.

Nose is sweet, malty with caramel...Nice red-tinged cola hue; head is of moderate dimensions with spotted lacy trails...Sweetness dominates the palate upon first sip, giving way to more subtle fruity tones.  Hops are detectable but clearly there to add sidebar comments.  The finish is slightly tangy.  The body is pleasantly full, more like a doppel than most Maibocks, and overall its "bigness" is a considerable asset, though its balance is a little too "malt-heavy" for my taste...but very good nonetheless.

Deep mahogany/ruby body with a quickly diminishing tan head.  Aroma is "bocky" (is that a word?), full of caramel and malty sweetness; very pleasant.  Taste is firm yet not overpowering, caramel and malt again, with some fruitiness.  Palate is very smooth, with a slighty sour and alcoholic finish.  Good stuff.

Pours a clear reddish-brown, with a medium sized tan head, mostly diminishing, leaving some lace.  Aroma is big & strong - tons of caramel, bread, and some appple and pear, backed with a mild hoppiness that keeps all the malt aromas in check.    Flavor starts sweet, like caramel covered apples slapped between a couple pieces of whole grain bread, ends with a pleasant and subtle bitterness.  Huge, bombarding mouthfeel, a lot of different flavors mingling about, coating the tongue, and lingering forever.  An amazing brew.
This one is very true to the German style. Very sweet flavor with low bitterness.

Big aroma of apricots, prunes and candied sweet potatoes.  Color is a deep russet.  Little head that leave quickley and leaves litle white floaters.  Taste is big sweet malts and dried fruits.  A little to sweet in the back of the throat on the finnish.
Hint aof malt and alcohol in the aroma.  Alcohol comes through in the body and throws off the malt balance a bit.  A decent brew but not outstanding.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2007 Thin creamy head which lends to some great lacing.  Excellent carbonation.  Aroma of malts and some light fruit.  Awesome color of deep red/brown.  Flavor is quite smooth with roasted malts, apple and a touch of smoke and alcohol.  Finish is excellent with some hops finally showing up and a nice slight bitter aftertaste.  Nice alcohol warming and presence.  A quality beer that is on the mellow side but still full of flavor and substance.
I think this ones my favorite of the series.  Great maltiness, light, almost minimalist hops, perfect balance.  I cant imagine this beer being done any better.

Apple, yeasty, bread aroma.  Whitish head mostly lasting.  Deep amber hue.  Very nice brew.  Maibocks are great.  Moderate sweetness initially, chewy, heavy malted character, with wonderful balancing hops in the finish.  A very nice brew, smuttynose impresses me occasionally with a good brew like this.
Hello Uncle Malty! Thank GOD for the BIG BEER series, this one is a onster for a maibock, after 22oz it felt more like a doppel.

Bottled (bomber).  Dark bronze body, mostly transparent, with huge foamy tan slow-diminishing head.  Promising.  Nose is loaded, I mean loaded with caramel malt, and malted milk as well.  Flavor again super sweet/malty; those looking for hops in their bocks had best avoid.  Finish extremely smooth, perhaps a bit too much; but overall this is a great sweet, full-bodied maibock.  Makes me miss Ayinger just a little less...
It pours with a foamy head and a clear dark orange body.  Slightly sweet, with a nice aftertaste.  Heavy malt character without a lot of hops.
No hops taste and very little carbonation, but still seemed very chewey.  Lots of malt character.  I agree with their slogan: Make mine a Smutty!
Nice palate, hardly carbonated at all, slightly creamy.  Very malty with a lot of flavour.  Well balanced despite no obvious hops.
Pretty good beer.  Nice inbetween winter and spring beer.  Very malty, and rich.  Slight hops flavor in the finish to balance it out.  Decent palate, nice color.
Wonderful malty, chewy Maibock.  Nice alcohol at the end, this is a very good spring or any time of the year beer.

The beer pours with a deep bronze color and a sandy off-white head color. Has a big malty sweet nose and a touch of alcohol in the aroma as well. The malt has an aroma of a chocolate milkshake. Very smooth, full, chewy and alightly bitter mouthfeel. Slightly sharp alcohol tinge on the back of the throat. A wonderful Maibock, make mine a Smutty!

So very very malty.  Starts over with a gorgeous, pretty clear, ruby-tinted color.  The aroma was made me think of some kind of fruity bread (raspberry maybe), but left me a little curious.  Malts come on stong with initial flavor and dominate the aftertaste as well.  Hops, an carbonation, were hardly noticeable.  It does get a bit alcoholic as it warms, but not that bad.  Its definately a beer one needs to enjoy, taking their time.  Nice stuff.
This beer presents a sweet nutty/malty nose.  A full bodied beer with a decent balance of chocolate malt and finishing hops.  A pleasant beer that will make you feel warm.  Cheers!
